p: Moreover, since 2015 a big continental outbreak is taking place in Central, South America and Caribbean countries. WHO declared Zika as a public health emergency mainly because an increasing number of fetal malformations observed during Zika outbreak. Later, in 2016, Zika virus was strongly associated with fetal malformations[ 7, 8]. The fact that Zika can be sexually transmitted increases the odds of spreading[ 8], and this is also a differential feature compared to other arbovirus.
